summary.headline: Math & AI Specialist | Turning Ideas into Reality with Data & Logic
summary.tagline: Building an AI that turns ideas into reality using my experiences as a Chemical Engineering Academic, Data Analysis Professional, Future Mathematics Major, & AI Advocate
summary.description: Mathematically minded problem solver with a passion for turning complex data into actionable insights. Currently pursuing a B.S. in Mathematics with a secondary discipline in Chemical Engineering at LSU (88/120 credits complete), building a strong foundation in statistical analysis, computational modeling, and applied problem-solving. My career shift from chemical engineering to mathematics reflects my commitment to data-driven decision-making and my interest in the rapidly evolving fields of analytics, machine learning, and AI.
summary.valueProposition: Merging mathematical rigor, data science skills, and creative problem-solving to deliver measurable impact in innovation-driven environments.

projects.projectDescription: The most architecturally advanced project in my portfolio. A self-documenting, data-driven professional platform built on Next.js 16 and React 19 with the React Compiler (babel-plugin-react-compiler). Every page, component, and data point on the live site is dynamically rendered from a single master_report.json file — a 1,200+ line structured 'digital twin' that serves as a normalized, version-controlled representation of identity, experience, credentials, skills, and projects. The JSON file acts as both the content management system and the single source of truth: editing one file propagates changes across 10 statically-generated routes, 5 reusable components, and a fully typed data access layer (11 accessor functions in masterReport.ts). The architecture is recursive — this project entry you're reading right now is itself rendered from that same JSON file.
projects.shortDescription: Self-documenting Next.js 16 platform powered by a 'digital twin' JSON architecture
projects.myRole: Sole Architect, Developer & Designer — end-to-end ownership from data modeling to DNS configuration
responsibilities: Designed the 'digital twin' JSON schema — a 12-section, deeply nested data model covering personal info, projects, experience, education, skills, certifications, volunteer work, and personality insights
Built a fully typed data access layer (masterReport.ts) with 11 accessor functions providing type-safe reads across the entire schema
Architected 10 Next.js App Router routes with React Server Components for zero-JS page loads
Developed 5 reusable React components (Navigation, Footer, ProjectCard, ContactForm, PrintButton) with responsive design, dark mode support, and mobile-first UX
Implemented dynamic project routing with generateStaticParams — 8 project detail pages pre-rendered at build time from JSON slugs
Configured production deployment pipeline: GitHub → Vercel CI/CD with custom domain DNS (A record + CNAME → ryanguidry.com)
Applied SEO best practices: semantic HTML, meta tags, Open Graph, structured heading hierarchy, and descriptive page titles
Defined TypeScript interfaces (types.ts) covering 13 exported types with strict mode enforcement

framework: Next.js 16.1.6 (App Router, React Server Components, generateStaticParams)

challengesFaced.description: Needed a content system that could represent an entire professional identity — projects, experience, education, skills, certifications, and personality profile — in a single, version-controlled file without a database or CMS
challengesFaced.solution: Designed a deeply nested JSON schema with 12 top-level sections and defined 13 TypeScript interfaces to enforce structure. Built 11 typed accessor functions in masterReport.ts that read from disk at build time, making the entire site statically generated from one file
challengesFaced.result: Zero-database architecture. Content updates require editing one JSON file and pushing to GitHub. The entire site rebuilds automatically in under 60 seconds via Vercel

challengesFaced.description: Each page (Home, About, Projects, Project Detail, Experience, Education, Skills, Resume, Contact) needed guaranteed access to specific slices of the JSON schema without runtime errors
challengesFaced.solution: Created a comprehensive type system in types.ts with interfaces for MasterReport, Project, Experience, Education, Skills, Certification, Volunteer, and InsightsProfile. Each accessor function in masterReport.ts returns a properly typed result, caught at compile time
challengesFaced.result: Zero runtime type errors in production. TypeScript catches all data access issues at build time before deployment

challengesFaced.challenge: Dynamic Static Generation for Project Pages
challengesFaced.description: 8 individual project detail pages needed to be statically generated from JSON data, each with unique slugs, tech stacks, challenges, and metrics
challengesFaced.solution: Used Next.js generateStaticParams to extract slugs from JSON at build time, generating static HTML for each project. The [slug] dynamic route resolves to pre-rendered pages with zero client-side data fetching
challengesFaced.result: All 8 project pages load instantly as static HTML. Adding a new project requires only adding a JSON object — no new files, no new routes, no code changes

challengesFaced.description: Configuring DNS records across two providers (Bluehost registrar + Vercel hosting) with proper A records, CNAME records, and SSL
challengesFaced.solution: Set up A record (76.76.21.21) and CNAME (cname.vercel-dns.com) on Bluehost, connected GitHub repo to Vercel for automatic deployments, and verified DNS propagation
challengesFaced.result: Live at ryanguidry.com with automatic SSL, push-to-deploy from any git commit, and global CDN distribution via Vercel's Edge Network

challengesFaced.description: The portfolio needed to showcase technical depth while also being the technical depth — the codebase is both the product and the proof of skill
challengesFaced.solution: Designed the system so the project entry for ryan-portfolio within master_report.json describes the exact architecture that renders it. The data model documents itself
challengesFaced.result: Recursive self-reference: this project description is rendered by the system it describes, demonstrating the architecture in real-time to anyone viewing the site

keyLearnings: Designed and implemented a 'digital twin' architecture — a pattern where a single JSON file represents an entire professional identity and drives all UI rendering
Mastered Next.js 16 App Router with React Server Components, achieving zero client-side JavaScript on static pages
Leveraged React 19 with the React Compiler (babel-plugin-react-compiler) for automatic performance optimization
Built a production TypeScript data access layer with 13 interfaces and 11 typed accessor functions
Learned end-to-end DNS configuration: domain registration, A/CNAME records, SSL provisioning, and CDN distribution
Developed expertise in static site generation with dynamic data — generating 8 unique project routes from a single JSON file
Applied information architecture principles to model complex, multi-dimensional professional data in a flat JSON structure
Gained fluency in CI/CD workflows: GitHub push → Vercel build → automatic deployment in under 60 seconds

impactMetrics.architecture: Zero-database, single-file content system driving 10 routes and 5 components
impactMetrics.typeSafety: 13 TypeScript interfaces, 11 typed accessor functions, 0 runtime type errors
impactMetrics.performance: 100% static pages — zero client-side data fetching on initial loads
impactMetrics.deployment: Push-to-deploy in <60 seconds via GitHub → Vercel CI/CD pipeline
impactMetrics.contentVelocity: Update entire site by editing one JSON file — no code changes needed
impactMetrics.codebase: 1,200+ line JSON schema, 55-line typed data layer, 185-line type definitions
impactMetrics.domain: Custom domain at ryanguidry.com with automatic SSL and global CDN

developmentTimeline.phase1: Data architecture design — JSON schema definition and TypeScript interface modeling
developmentTimeline.phase2: Core platform build — Next.js 16 scaffolding, data access layer, 10 routes, 5 components
developmentTimeline.phase3: Production deployment — Vercel CI/CD, DNS configuration, custom domain setup
developmentTimeline.phase4: Content population — Migrating all professional data into master_report.json
developmentTimeline.ongoing: Continuous iteration — adding projects, refining UI, expanding data model, improving SEO

projects.targetAudience: Recruiters, hiring managers, potential collaborators, and technical audiences evaluating full-stack architecture skills

projects.projectDescription: A Python automation tool designed to clean, organize, and standardize metadata for large music libraries. Handles common issues like inconsistent formatting, missing album art, incorrect tags, and duplicate files. Integrates with MusicBrainz API for accurate metadata retrieval.
projects.shortDescription: Python CLI for automated music library organization and metadata cleanup
responsibilities: Requirements analysis (personal pain points + community research)
Python architecture and file system handling
Metadata processing logic and API integration
CLI interface design and user documentation
Testing across diverse music file formats

challengesFaced.description: Supporting MP3, FLAC, AAC, M4A, OGG, etc.
challengesFaced.solution: Leveraged Mutagen's universal metadata handling
challengesFaced.result: 95%+ format compatibility

challengesFaced.description: Identifying duplicates despite different filenames/bitrates
challengesFaced.solution: Implemented audio fingerprinting with AcoustID
challengesFaced.result: 98% duplicate detection accuracy

challengesFaced.description: Standardizing tags across different music sources
challengesFaced.solution: MusicBrainz API integration with fallback logic
challengesFaced.result: 90%+ metadata accuracy improvement

keyLearnings: Mastered Python audio processing libraries and metadata standards
Developed expertise in file system operations and batch processing
Learned API integration patterns for music metadata services
Gained experience in CLI tool design for non-technical users
Understood audio fingerprinting algorithms and duplicate detection
projects.targetAudience: Music enthusiasts, DJs, audio engineers managing large digital music collections

projects.projectDescription: An immersive, browser-based audio visualizer that transforms music into cosmic visual experiences. Uses the Web Audio API to analyze audio frequencies in real-time and renders dynamic particle systems, waveforms, and nebula effects on HTML5 Canvas.
projects.shortDescription: Real-time browser audio visualizer with cosmic particle effects
projects.myRole: Sole Developer - Creative coding and audio engineering
responsibilities: Web Audio API integration and frequency analysis
HTML5 Canvas rendering and particle system design
Real-time audio visualization algorithms
UI/UX design for interactive music experience
Deployment to Vercel

challengesFaced.description: Rendering thousands of particles at 60fps while analyzing audio

challengesFaced.result: Smooth 60fps visualization with complex particle systems

challengesFaced.description: Translating raw FFT data into visually meaningful effects
challengesFaced.solution: Custom frequency band mapping with logarithmic scaling
challengesFaced.result: Visually responsive effects that match the music feel

keyLearnings: Mastered Web Audio API and real-time frequency analysis
Developed expertise in HTML5 Canvas animation and particle systems
Learned performance optimization for real-time graphics rendering
Gained experience in creative coding and generative art
projects.targetAudience: Music enthusiasts, creative coders, and anyone who loves visual art
